title: Asus G73JH

embed.description: The G73 is the latest gaming notebook in ASUS' successful G-series product line. This 17.3-inch monster has a Core i7 processor, 8GB of RAM, and the most powerful mobile video card available, the ATI Mobility Radeon HD 5870. Read on for our take. Special thanks go out to Justin at XoticPC.com for sending us this unit.

body:
So I found a pretty cheap laptop as shown in the link above, but it's been used for 3 years already. Would this be able to handle League, and if so, at around how much at which settings?  

Don't say "get a pc" etc. since I need a laptop right now and it would be nice if it could run League as well.

replies.body: *I see, main worry is that it's already 3 years old and people say laptops die after a few years* they dont die specs wise they die in colour,shape etc (lol)
lmao its better then my pc and i can run league on high settings easy

For your puposes mate, this is a good idea. I have a g74sx, its a model up from yours and it runs league really well, on max settign etc, its already 3 years old itself, yours might be a little older. I bought mine in 2012 for over 3g (NZD) back then, so you can appreciate how much they went for brand new. 
It will be a good buy for LOL. 
Just check the screen resolution is 1080p as some arn't. There are many varients to the G73jh model. I have 1080p at 120 hertz, as i got the 3d model. It goes great and i'd imagine the g73jh would as well. (Just ask if it has been overclocked, as it was a higher end gaming laptop in its day).
Thanks for the response man! Now I can buy it with assurance that it's gonna run League quite well even with its age
Build your own desktop, mine is 4 years old and I can run most new games on ultra at 60+ FPS, I run League at 417FPS, lol.
Already said that I require a laptop for schoolwork etc, just would be better if it could run League too

>
> Already said that I require a laptop for schoolwork etc, just would be better if it could run League too
